content.question: A decreasing function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> satisfies <math alttext="g of 4, equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of 4, equals negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements about the inverse of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> must be true?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 6, equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of negative 2, equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 6, equals, negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 6, equals, negative one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 6, equals, negative one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
